thread.title: Tributes paid to ‘lovely’ grandmother killed in Meath crash
thread.title_full: Tributes paid to ‘lovely’ grandmother killed in Meath crash

author: Philip Downes
title: Tributes paid to ‘lovely’ grandmother killed in Meath crash
text:
Tributes have been paid to a ‘lovely’ grandmother who was tragically killed in a crash in Co Meath on Monday.
Patricia ‘Tish’ Reilly, 68, was tragically killed in the single vehicle collision at around 1am on Monday, June 10 at Main Street Ratoath in Co Meath.
Ms O’Reilly, originally from Tara in Co Meath, was pronounced dead at the scene. Her death notice reads that she’s predeceased by her son Wayne, parents Bill and Betty, and her siblings.
Tributes have been paid to a ‘lovely’ grandmother who was tragically killed in a crash in Co Meath on Monday. Pic: RIP.ie ‘Patricia will be very sadly missed by her loving husband Bernard (Barney), sons Keith & Trevor, daughter Shelley, grandchildren, great-grandchildren, daughter-in-law Faye, brothers, sisters, brothers-in-law, sisters-in-law, nieces, nephews, relatives and friends,’ her death notice adds.
Tributes poured in for Ms O’Reilly following her death, with one person writing ‘My deepest condolences to all of Tish’s family. Tish was a lovely lady, I am deeply saddened to hear this news today may she RIP.’
‘I have absolutely no words. Tish you will live within our broken hearts forever,’ another wrote. ‘Rest in peace my dear friend.’
Ms Reilly was tragically killed in a single vehicle collision on Main Street Ratoath in Co Meath on Monday. Pic: Colin Keegan, Collins Dublin Ms O’Reilly will be reposing from St Joseph’s Chapel of Rest Old Johnstown, Navan on Friday (June 14) from 5pm to 7pm. Arriving to St Colmcille’s Church on Saturday for an 11am funeral mass. Cremation will take place in Dardistown crematorium at 1.30pm. Family flowers only by request.
Gardaí are appealing for any witnesses to Monday’s crash to come forward. Any road users who may have camera footage (including dash-cam) and were travelling in the Main Street area of Ratoath between 12:45am and 1am on Monday June 10 are asked to contact Gardaí.
Anyone with any information is asked to contact Ashbourne Garda Station on 01 8010600, the Garda Confidential Line on 1800 666 111, or any Garda Station.
